title: Carol Vorderman's Pride Of Britain looks over the years from smart chic to sexy siren

Carol Vorderman's style has evolved over the years and her choices of ensembles for the Pride Of Britain awards has showcased her love for silky gowns, form-fitting dresses and Grecian inspired garments over the last 20 years.

In 1999 the former Countdown host decided on a smart casual look as she took to the podium to host the event that honours British people who have acted bravely or extraordinarily in challenging situations.

The brunette, 58, who was 38 at the time, opted for a red chic red ensemble underneath a tailored black blazer.

At the first ceremony she sported a short pixie-cut hair style and kept her make-up natural.

For the event that took place in the millennium, Carol upped the style stakes in a violet slashed neck three-quarter length sleeve top matched with a satin a-line skirt.

Giving the simple yet chic outfit some sparkle, the star adorned her neck with a gem encrusted choker.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

She completed her on-stage look by enhancing her pout with a berry coloured lipgloss and dusted her eyelids with purple hued eye-shadow.

In 2001, Carol power dressed for the event in a shiny orange jacket that featured oversized lapels and large shoulders.

The front of the jacket tied across her middle atop of brown form-fitting dress.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

The Welsh native wore a statement gold cross pendant around her neck and lined her brown eyes with blue shadow.

The TV favourite showcased a stunning ensemble in her fourth year of hosting the awards in 2002.

Oozing radiance, the star, who had grown out her short tresses to a shoulder length style, wore a gold satin skirt with a sleeveless top tucked into.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

The look was the most skin she had flaunted since starting her hosting duties as it showed off her toned arms.

2003 saw Carol in a sexy red dress that showed off her ample assets thanks to its sizzling off-the-shoulder design which was crafted out of a chiffon material.

Continuing her sultry look, the bombshell wore a string of purple stones along her décolletage.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

She styled her locks in a straight style as well as storming the stage with a fringe.

The following year, in 2004, Carol brought the glamour in a sparkling gold dress that clung to her hourglass curves.

She also had her hair lightened with caramel high-lights which were curled and cascaded down her shoulders.

2005 was Carol's third golden gown since she started as the master of ceremonies for the annual event.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: IAN VOGLER)

She opted for a elegant one piece that had a plunging neck line and flattering ruching along the stomach.

The household name's tiny waist was highlighted with a sash in the matching material.

Carol modelled a sweeping side fringe and her pretty features were enhanced with radiant make-up.

In 2006 the star styled it up in a sophisticated white Grecian style gown.

(Image: JAMES VELLACOTT)

She completed her refined look with silver stilettos and hung sparkly diamond earrings in her ears.

The next year saw Carol flaunt her shape in a figure-hugging nude one shouldered evening gown with a tulle skirt detail from her mid-thigh to the floor.

Ensuring all eyes were on her, the glistening outfit was embellished with crystals and she wore her hair in a half up-do.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

2008 saw Carol opt for an ethereal style in a pastel purple empire-waist dress that was covered with a layer of silver sequin lace that had a saucy v-neck and capped sleeves.

For 2009, the gorgeous presenter pulled out all the stop in a bandage dress with a sheer skirt.

She poured her shapely physique into the navy coloured dress that showed off her peachy bottom and perky bust.

Carol channeled her inner goth in 2010 as she stunned in a black corseted gown with a sweetheart neckline and silver stoned decorations under her cleavage and across her hips.

For the eleventh year of the event she dyed her hair a warm chestnut tone and kept her glossy locks straight.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: MDM)

For the 2011 edition of the ceremony Carol decided on a satin slate grey dress.

The stylish gown had a square neck and the design was similar to the styles she modelled in 2007 and 2009 with a flowing skirt below her thighs.

She decided on a elegant up-do for the evening which was the first time since the awards began in 1999 that she wore her hair completely up.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: DAILY MIRROR)

Carols 2012 ensemble was a classy affair with her stepping onto the stage in a dark blue fit and flare floor-length dress that had a sequined panel down the front.

The stunner rocked big hair that was puffed up with voluminous curls.

2013 saw Carol return to red as she slipped into bardot style fishtail dress.

Giving off Hollywood vibes, she ensured her attention grabbing dress was only accessorised with dazzling diamond earrings.

Carol once again showed off her envy-inducing physique in 2014 by wearing a bodycon white lace dress.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

The pretty dress had a nude slip underneath which gave the illusion that it was semi-sheer.

She swept her blonde tinged hair over her shoulder and wowed with a palette smokey eye shadow on her eyelids.

In 2015, Carol switched up her appearance by going completely blonde.

The siren paraded her curvy rear on stage in a black lycra fishtail skirt paired with a gold lace sleeveless top.

Carol once again selected a racy red gown in 2016.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Steve Bainbridge/Daily Mirror)

(Image: Andy Stenning/Daily Mirror)

The glamorous star strode out in a lace red dress that her matching bra could be seen underneath.

Her long pins were seen at times thanks to the flirty slit in the side of the billowing skirt of the brightly coloured garment.

Carol's 2017 look was stunning as she wowed in an asymmetric silver dress that was decorated with a thin layer of tulle over the bodice.

She kept her platinum locks down in beach waves and kept her jewels to a minimum.

2018 saw the mathematician showcasing her sartorial flair in a navy silk dress that had silver embellished sides.

In the most recent ceremony of 2019, the personality commanded attention in a silver metallic dress that had a long train that grazed along the floor.

The bodice style showed off her upper body and the way the dress nipped in at the waist allowed her perfect shape to be seen.
description: The presenter has showcased a range of styles since she began hosting the award ceremony in 1999
